Grain.Do: Warm, cooked grains like oats (1/2 cup cooked), quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), basmati rice (1/2 cup cooked). Prioritize whole, grounding grains.
Grain.Dont: Dry, puffed cereals, large quantities of raw grains, white bread, overly processed grains.

Legume.Do: Cooked moong dal (1/2 cup cooked), masoor dal (1/2 cup cooked), split chickpeas (chana dal) (1/2 cup cooked). Ensure well-cooked and easily digestible.
Legume.Dont: Dry beans, large amounts of raw legumes, canned beans with added salt or sugar, sprouts.

Veg.Do: Cooked root vegetables like sweet potatoes (1/2 cup), carrots (1/2 cup), beets (1/4 cup). Steamed or sautéed zucchini (1 cup), asparagus (1 cup). Warm, cooked vegetables are best.
Veg.Dont: Raw, cold vegetables, cruciferous vegetables in large amounts (broccoli, cauliflower) unless well-cooked, bitter gourds.

Spices.Do: Warming spices like ginger (1/2 inch piece), cinnamon (1/4 tsp), cardamom (1-2 pods), turmeric (1/4 tsp), cumin (1/4 tsp).
Spices.Dont: Excessive use of very pungent or heating spices like red chili powder, black pepper.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked spinach (1 cup), kale (1 cup), swiss chard (1 cup). Steamed or sautéed to reduce Vata-aggravating qualities.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens, large quantities of very bitter leafy greens.

Oil.Do: Sesame oil (1-2 tsp), ghee (1-2 tsp). Used in moderation for cooking and drizzling.
Oil.Dont: Cold-pressed oils in large quantities, fried foods.

Fruits.Do: Sweet, ripe fruits like cooked apples (1/2), pears (1/2), berries (1/4 cup), banana (1/2 small).
Fruits.Dont: Raw, unripe, or dried fruits. Sour fruits like citrus (in moderation, if tolerated), very astringent fruits.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Almonds (soaked overnight, 4-5 pieces), walnuts (2-3 pieces), dates (1-2).
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Large quantities of dry, raw nuts. Unsoaked nuts.

Milk product.Do: Warm, organic whole milk (1 cup with cardamom), yogurt (1/2 cup, preferably homemade and fresh, diluted with water).
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, heavy cream, aged cheeses, excessive amounts of yogurt.

Condiments.Do: Fresh ginger-garlic paste (1 tsp), mild chutneys (tamarind, mint - in moderation), lemon juice (1 tsp, in cooked dishes).
Condiments.Dont: Spicy, sour, or fermented condiments in excess. Vinegar-based pickles.
